questions.question:
The standard form of a Fredholm linear integral equation is of the form

$ \psi(x) u(x) = f(x) + \lambda \int_{a}^{b}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt, \ \ a \leq x,t \leq b $

An integral equation is an equation having the
unknown function u(x) and its derivatives.
$ F(x) = \int_{0}^{x} (x - t)^3 u(t) dt \Rightarrow F''(x) = ? $

Which is the equivalent
integral equation for the IVP
$ u'' - 5u' + 4u = -1 + 4x , \ u(0) = 3, \ u'(0) = 9 $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) =3x − 5x^3 + \int_{-1}^{1} (1 - xt ) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = x+ (1 - x) e^{x} + \int_0^{1} x^2 e^{t(x - 1)} u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 1 - \int_{0}^{\pi/4} \sec^2 x u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the equivalent IVP to the Integral equation
$ u(x) = -5 + 6x + \int_{0}^{x}( 5 - 6x + 6t) u(t) dt \ ? $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 2 + 5x - 3x^2 + \int_{-1}^{1} (1 - xt ) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the equivalent Integral Equation for the BVP
$ y'' + 4y = 0, 0< x < 1, y(0) = y(1) = 0 ? $

variants.title: $ u(x) = cos x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}9t(1 + x),\;0 \le t \le x\\9x(1 + t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = 1 + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\2x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

u(x)=x2+∫10K(x,t)u(t)dt$ u(x) = x^2 + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where K(x,t)={4x(1−x),0≤t≤x4t(1−t),x≤t≤1$ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4x(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4t(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

questions.question:
Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = e^x + 12x^2 + (3 + e)x − 4 − \int_{0}^{1} (x - t) u(t) dt ? $
(Hint: using the Modified Decomposition Method )

Which is a solution of the Fredholm integral equation
$ u(x) = \frac{5}{6}x - \frac{1}{9} + \frac{1}{3}\int_{0}^{1} (x + t) u(t) \ dt \ \ ? $

Which of the following is correct
classification of the integral equation?
$ u(x) = e^x + \int_{0}^{x} t^2 u^2(t) dt $

$ \alpha(x) $, and $ \beta(x) $, in a typical integral equation
$ u(x) = f(x) + \int_{\alpha (x)}^{\beta(x)}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt. $
is called kernel functions of the equation.

Which is the equivalent Integral Equation for the BVP
$ y'' + 4y = sinx, 0< x < 1, y(0) = 0,y(1) = 0 ? $

variants.title: $ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\2x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4x(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4t(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = cos x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4t(1 + x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4x(1 + t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

questions.question:
Which of the following is correct
classification of the integral equation?
$ u'''(x) = -12x^4 + \int_{0}^{x} (x - t) u(t) dt, u(0) = u'(0) = 0, u''(0) = 2 $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 1 + x + e^x - \frac{2}{3} \int_{0}^{1} xt u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the equivalent IVP to the Integral equation
$ u(x) = x + \int_{0}^{x}(t - x) u(t) dt \ ? $

An integral equation is an equation in which the
unknown function u(x) to be determined
appears under the integral sign.

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 4 + 45x + 26x^2 − \int_{0}^{1} (1 + 30xt^2 + 12x^2t)u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 5x + \int_{-1}^{1} ( 1 - xt) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)
$ F(x) = \int_{0}^{x} xt u(t) dt \Rightarrow F''(x) = ? $

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = 1 - \frac{1}{15} x^2 + \int_{-1}^{1} (xt + x^2t^2) u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)

What is the value of $ f(x) =? $
If $ u(x) = e^{4x} $
is a solution of the Volterra integral equation
$ u(x) = f(x) + 16 \int_{0}^{x}(x - t) u(t) \ dt $

Find $ c=? $
If the equivalent integral equation of the IVP
$ u''(x)+6u'(x)+7u(x)=9\sin x,u(0)=2,u'(0)=0 $
is of the form
$ u(x)=a+bx+c\sin x-\int_0^x [d+e(x-t)]u(t)dt $.

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = e^{2x} - \frac{1}{4}(e^2 - 1)x + \int_{0}^{1} xt u(t) dt ? $
(Hint: using Modified Decomposition Method)

A typical form of an integral equation in u(x) is of the form

$ u(x) = f(x) + \lambda \int_{\alpha (x)}^{\beta(x)}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt. $

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) =e^x + 1 − e + \int_0^1 u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)

$ u(x) = x $ is a solution of the Fredholm integral equation
$ u(x) = x - \frac{\pi}{12} + \frac{1}{3} \int_{0}^{1} \frac{1}{1 + u^2(t)} dt. $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 3x^2 − 5x^3 + \int_{-1}^{1} x^4 t u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the equivalent IVP to the Integral equation
$ u(x) = \tan x - \int_{0}^{x} u(t) dt, \ x<\frac{\pi}{2} \ ? $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 2x + e^x - \frac{3}{4} \int_{0}^{1} xt u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = \frac{2}{15}+ \frac{7}{12}x + x^2 + x^3 − \int_{0}^{1} (1 + x - t) u(t) dt ? $
(Hint: using the Modified Decomposition Method )

Which is the equivalent Integral Equation for the BVP
$ y'' + 2y = 4, 0< x < 1, y(0) =0, y'(1) = 1 ? $

variants.title: $ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4x(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4t(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = 4 - 2x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t,\;0 \le t \le x\\2x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = -2x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}tx(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = 2x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t,\;0 \le t \le x\\2x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = 4 + 2x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}t,\;0 \le t \le x\\x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

questions.question:
The standard form of a Fredholm linear integral equation of 2.kind is of the form

$ u(x) = f(x) + \lambda \int_{a}^{b}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt, \ \ a \leq x,t \leq b $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 2 − 2x + 5x^4 + 7x^5 + \int_{-1}^{1} ( 1 - xt) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)
$ \frac{d}{dx}\int_{x}^{x^2} e^{xt} u(t)dt = ? $

Which is the equivalent
integral equation for the IVP
$ u'' + u = 3 , \ u(0) = 0, \ u'(0) = 2 $

Which of the following is correct
classification of the integral equation?
$ u(x) = 4x + 5 + \int_{0}^{1} (x - t)^3 u(t)dt $

Which is the equivalent IVP to the Integral equation
$ u(x) = x^4 + x^2 + 2\int_{0}^{x} (x - t)^2 u(t) dt \ ? $

$ u(x) = \sin x $ is a solution of the Volterra integral equation
$ u(x) = x - \int_{0}^{x}(x - t) u(t) dt $

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) =\pi x + \sin2 x + x \int_{-\pi}^{\pi} t u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)
Which of the following is NOT a class of integral equations?

The standard form of a Fredholm linear integral equation of 1.kind is of the form

$ f(x) = \lambda \int_{a}^{b}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt, \ \ a \leq x,t \leq b $

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = \frac{1}{1 + x^2} - 2\sinh \frac{\pi}{4} + \int_{-1}^{1} e^{\arctan t} u(t) dt ? $
(Hint: using the Modified Decomposition Method )

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = −11 + 9x + x^3 + x^4 − \int_{0}^{1} (20x − 30t)u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

$ \alpha(x) $, and $ \beta(x) $, in a typical integral equation
$ u(x) = f(x) + \int_{\alpha (x)}^{\beta(x)}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt. $
is called limits of integration.

Which is the equivalent Integral Equation for the BVP
$ y'' + 4y = 0, 0< x < 1, y(0) =1, y'(1) = 0 ? $

variants.title: $ u(x) = -2x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t,\;0 \le t \le x\\2x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = 4x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t,\;0 \le t \le x\\2x),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = x + 4 + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}t^2,\;0 \le t \le x\\ x^2,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t,\;0 \le t \le x\\2x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = x - 4 + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4t,\;0 \le t \le x\\4x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

questions.question:
Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = (\frac{2\pi}{3} - ln(2 + \sqrt{3}))x + \sec x\tan x - \int_{0}^{\pi/3} xt u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 11x + 10x^2 + x^3 − \int_{0}^{1} (30xt^2 + 20x^2t)u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)
$ F(x) = \int_{0}^{x} \cosh(x^3+ t^3) dt \Rightarrow F'(x) = ? $

Which is the equivalent
integral(integro-differential) equation for the IVP
$ (1 + x^3)y' + 3x^2 y = 1,\ y(0) = 0 $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 5x + \int_{-1}^{1} (1 - xt ) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the equivalent IVP to the Integral equation
$ u(x) = x - \cos x + \int_{0}^{x} (x - t) u(t) dt \ ? $

Which is the equivalent Integral Equation for the BVP
$ y'' + 9y = \cos x, 0< x < 1, y(0) = y(1) = 0 ? $

variants.title: $ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}9t(1 + x),\;0 \le t \le x\\9x(1 + t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = cos x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\2x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = \cos x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}9t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\9x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4x(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4t(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

questions.question:
Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 3x + 3x^2 + \frac{1}{2} \int_{0}^{1} x^2 t u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which of the following is correct
classification of the integral equation?
$ u(x) = 1 + \int_{0}^{x} sin(u(t))dt $
$ \frac{d}{dx}\int_{0}^{x} (x - t)u(t)dt = ? $

$ K(x,t) $, in a typical integral equation of the form

$ u(x) = f(x) + \int_{\alpha (x)}^{\beta(x)}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt. $
is called kernel of the equation.

$ u(x) = \sinh x $ is a solution of the Volterra integral equation
$ u(x) = x + \int_{0}^{x} (x - t) u(t) dt. $

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = \cos x + 2x + \int_0^{\pi} xt \ u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)

Which is the equivalent
integral(integro-differential) equation for the IVP
$ y'(x) + y(x) = e^{-x}, y(0) = 1 $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = −8 + 11x − x^2 + x^3 − \int_{0}^{1} (12x − 20t)u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

A typical form of an integral equation in u(x) is of the form

$ u(x) = f(x) + \int_{\alpha (x)}^{\beta(x)}\ u(t)\ dt. $

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = e^{x+1} + e^{x−1} + (e^2 + 1)e^{x−1} − \int_{0}^{1} e^{x - t} u(t) dt ? $
(Hint: using the Modified Decomposition Method )

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = −6 + 14x^4 + 21x^2 + x − \int_{-1}^{1} (x^4 - t^4) u(t) dt ? $
(Hint: using the Modified Decomposition Method )
$ \frac{d}{dx}\int_{x}^{x^2} (x - t)\cos t u(t)dt = ? $

variants.title: $ 2x(x − x^2) cos x^2 + sin x^2 − sin x $
$ 2x(x + x^2) cos x^2 - sin x^2 − sin x $

questions.question:
Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = - 1 + \cos x + \int_{0}^{\pi/2} u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

The standard form of a Volterra linear integral equation of the 2.kind is of the form

$ u(x) = f(x) + \lambda \int_{a(x)}^{b(x)}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt $

Find $ d=? $
If the equivalent integral equation of the IVP
$ u''(x)+10u'(x)+4u(x)=6\sin x,u(0)=2,u'(0)=3 $
is of the form
$ u(x)=a+bx+c\sin x-\int_0^x [d+e(x-t)]u(t)dt $.

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = \sin x - x + \int_0^{\frac{\pi}{2}} xt \ u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = −15 + 10x^3 + x^4 − \int_{0}^{1} (20x^3 − 56t^3)u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

$ u(x) = \cos x $ is a solution of the Fredholm integro-differential equation
$ u'''(x) = 1 + \sin x - \int_{0}^{\pi/2} (x - t) u(t) dt, \ u(0) =1,u'(0) =0,u''(0) =-1. $

Which of the following is correct
classification of the integral equation?
$ u(x) = x + \int_{0}^{1} (x - t)^2 u(t) dt $

Which is the equivalent IVP to the Integral equation
$ u(x) = 1 + x + \frac{5}{2}x^2 + \int_{0}^{x}[ 3 + 6(x - t) - \frac{5}{2}(x- t)^2] u(t) dt \ ? $

$ K(x,t) $, in a typical integral equation of the form

$ u(x) = f(x) + \int_{\alpha (x)}^{\beta(x)}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt. $
is called unknown function.

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = -1 + ln(1 + x) + \int_{0}^{e - 1} u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the equivalent Integral Equation for the BVP
$ y'' + xy = 0, 0< x < 1, y(0) = y'(1) = 0 ? $

variants.title: $ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t,\;0 \le t \le x\\2x),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t,\;0 \le t \le x\\2x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}t^2,\;0 \le t \le x\\ x^2,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = -2x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}tx,\;0 \le t \le x\\x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}xt,\;0 \le t \le x\\x^2,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

questions.question:
Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = (\pi + 2)x + \sin x − \cos x − x \int_{0}^{\pi} t u(t) dt ? $
(Hint: using the Modified Decomposition Method )

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 2 + 5x - 3x^2 + \int_{-1}^{1} ( 1 - xt) u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)
$ F(x) = \int_{x}^{x^2} ln(1 + xt) dt \Rightarrow F'(x) = ? $

The standard form of a Volterra linear integral equation is of the form

$ \psi(x) u(x) = f(x) + \lambda \int_{a(x)}^{b(x)}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt $
Which of the following is NOT a class of integral equations?

$ u(x) = x^3 $ is a solution of the Fredholm integral equation
$ u'(x) = \frac{2}{3} + \int_{0}^{1} t u(t) dt. $

Which is the equivalent Integral Equation for the BVP
$ y'' + y = 0, 0< x < 1, y(0) = y'(1) = 0 ? $

variants.title: $ u(x) = \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}t,\;0 \le t \le x\\x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\2x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}t,\;0 \le t \le x\\x,\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = -2x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}tx(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4x(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4t(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = 2 + \cos x + \int_0^{\pi} t u(t) dt $

$ u'' - 5u' + 6u = 6x + 7, \ u(0) = 1, \ u'(0) = 1 $

$ u(x) =\lambda \int_{a(x)}^{b(x)}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt $

$ u(x) = x^2 − x^3 + \int_{0}^{1} (1 + xt ) u(t)dt $

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = xe^x - \frac{1}{2} + \frac{1}{2} \int_0^{1} u(t) dt $
(Hint: using Adomian Decomposition Method)

The standard form of a Fredholm linear integral equation of 2.kind is of the form

$ f(x) = \lambda \int_{a}^{b}\ K(x,t) \ u(t)\ dt, \ \ a \leq x,t \leq b $

Which is the equivalent IVP to the Integral equation
$ u(x) = x + \int_{0}^{x} (x - t) u(t) dt \ ? $

u(x)=32$ u(x) = \frac{3}{2} $ is a solution of the Volterra integral equation
∫x0(x−t)12u(t)dt=x32$ \int_{0}^{x} (x - t)^{\frac{1}{2}} u(t) dt = x^{\frac{3}{2}} $

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = \sec^2 x − 1 + \int_{0}^{\pi/4} u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = 1 + 9x + 2x^2 + x^3 − \int_{0}^{1} (20xt + 10x^2t^2)u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)

Find $ d=? $
If the equivalent integral equation of the IVP
$ u''(x)-6u'(x)-4u(x)=-7x^2-2x-4,u(0)=1,u'(0)=2 $
is of the form
$ u(x)=a+bx+cx^2+dx^3+ex^4+\int_0^x [f+g(x-t)]u(t)dt $.

Which is the equivalent Integral Equation for the BVP
$ y'' + 2xy = 1, 0< x < 1, y(0) = 0,y(1) = 0 ? $

variants.title: $ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2t(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\2x(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = 1 + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2xt(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\2x^2(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = 1 + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}2xt(1 + x),\;0 \le t \le x\\2x^2(1 + t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = sin x + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}4x(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\4t(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $
$ u(x) = 1 + \int_0^1 K(x, t)u(t)dt $, where $ K(x,t) = \left\{ \begin{array}{l}xt(1 - x),\;0 \le t \le x\\x^2(1 - t),\;x \le t \le 1\end{array} \right. $

questions.question:
Which is the solution of the equation
$ u(x) = \frac{\pi}{2}x + \sin x - \cos x + \int_{0}^{\pi} x\cos t u(t)dt $
(Hint: using direct computation method)
$ \frac{d}{dx}\int_{0}^{x} (x - t)^2u(t)dt = ? $

Which is the solution of the
Fredholm Integral equation
$ u(x) = e^{x}(e^{1/3} - 1) + e^{2x} - \frac{1}{3} \int_{0}^{1} e^{x - \frac{5}{3}t} u(t) dt ? $
(Hint: using Modified Decomposition Method)
